abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo plans to highlight state's progress against spread of HIV infection in speech at Apollo Theater to commemorate World AIDS Day; speech will focus in particular on fact that prescriptions for Truvada, drug that protects against acquiring HIV, have tripled in New York State since 2014 and transmission of HIV from mothers to their children has dropped to zero for first time since AIDS epidemic began.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is expected to announce Tuesday that more New Yorkers are taking the H.I.V. drug Truvada, and that the number of infections transmitted from mother to child has dropped to zero in the state.

headline.main: Cuomo to Highlight New York’s Progress in AIDS Fight
headline.print_headline: Cuomo to Highlight New York’s Progress in AIDS Fight

snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is expected to announce Tuesday that more New Yorkers are taking the H.I.V. drug Truvada, and that the number of infections transmitted from mother to child has dropped to zero in the state.
